derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French repeticion or Latin repetitio(n-), from repetere (see repeat)

entry.tran: (常指令人不快的事件的)反复发生，重复出现，重演
entry.def: If there is a repetition of an event, usually an undesirable event, it happens again.

example.ex: Today the city government has taken measures to prevent a repetition of last year's confrontation...
example.tran: 今天市政府已经采取措施，防止去年的冲突重演。

example.ex: Collins wants to avoid repetition of the confusion that followed the discovery in 1989 of the cystic fibrosis gene.
example.tran: 科林斯想要避免1989年发现囊肿性纤维化致病基因后的那种混乱局面再次出现。

entry.def: Repetition means using the same words again.

example.ex: He could also have cut out much of the repetition and thus saved many pages.
example.tran: 他原本也可以砍去许多重复的内容，从而缩减许多页。

sentences.sentence: "the events today were a repeat of yesterday's"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of doing or performing again
3. the repeated use of the same word or word pattern as a rhetorical device

sentences.en: That is a mere repetition of what you said before.

sentences.en: He has a repetition of a previous talk.
